localization.examples.EKFTwoD¶

class localization.examples.EKFTwoD(x_dim=1, u_dim=0, z_dim=1)¶

Bases: gaussian.ExtendedKalmanFilter

Simple Cartesian plane EKF: x and y position, body frame velocity, heading, angular velocity. Measures distance and bearing to a fixed landmark. Here as an example

__init__(x_dim=1, u_dim=0, z_dim=1)¶

Construct the Kalman filter by providing dimensions.

Parameters

  • x_dim (INT) – Length of the state vector. The default is 1. Used to create

  • u_dim (INT) – Length of the control input vector. The default is 0.

  • z_dim (INT) – Length of the measurement or observation vector. The default is 1.

Returns

The Kalman Filter object

predict(u)¶

Predict (propagate) the Kalman Filter’s state estimate. This method should not be called directly. Call step instead.

Parameters

u (array or array-like) – the control input vector

step(u=None, z=None)¶

Executes one cycle of the Kalman Filter

Parameters

  • u (array or array-like) – the control input vector

  • z (array or array-like) – the measurement or observation vector

update(z)¶

The measurement update function. This method should not be called directly. Call step instead.

Parameters

z (array or array-like) – the measurement or observation vector
